support_summary: ATXN3 has been shown to deubiquitinate and stabilize the translation initiation factor eIF3a (EIF3A), thereby promoting protein synthesis. The interaction was confirmed by co-immunoprecipitation.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit A (EIF3A). EIF3A is a core component of the eIF3 complex, which is essential for recruiting the 40S ribosomal subunit to mRNA, a rate-limiting step in the initiation of protein synthesis.
functions.effect_description: By stabilizing EIF3A, ATXN3 can positively influence the rate of global or specific protein synthesis, linking protein quality control (via deubiquitination) to the production of new proteins.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 deubiquitinates EIF3A → EIF3A is stabilized → Enhanced assembly of translation initiation complexes → Increased protein synthesis
specific_effects: eIF3 is involved in nearly every step of mRNA translation, from initiation to termination and quality control.
ATXN3 has been shown to promote the progression of certain cancers by stabilizing translation factors like EIF5A2, a similar mechanism.

evidence.paper_title: eIF-Three to Tango: emerging functions of translation initiation factor eIF3 in protein synthesis and disease
The deubiquitinating enzyme ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by stabilizing EIF5A2

mechanism: ATXN3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 3 subunit A (EIF3A). EIF3A is a core component of the eIF3 complex, which is essential for recruiting the 40S ribosomal subunit to mRNA, a rate-limiting step in the initiation of protein synthesis.
effect: By stabilizing EIF3A, ATXN3 can positively influence the rate of global or specific protein synthesis, linking protein quality control (via deubiquitination) to the production of new proteins.
summary: ATXN3 activates EIF3A to modulate protein synthesis, ultimately affecting increased protein synthesis.

evidence.paper_title: eIF-Three to Tango: emerging functions of translation initiation factor eIF3 in protein synthesis and disease
The deubiquitinating enzyme ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by stabilizing EIF5A2
